title: Lions Tour Event Videos
subtitle: Event video packages for 2025 British & Irish Lions tour
brief: Created video content for multiple rugby events during the 2025 British & Irish Lions tour to Australia, including school, club, and charity functions.
description:
Delivered video packages for various rugby events celebrating the British and Irish Lions tour year, working in collaboration with legendary Australian rugby commentator Greg Clark who MC'd all events. The portfolio included The Anglican Church Grammar School's lunch at The Star (the largest production with 1100 guests), Powerhouse Rugby Club, Emerge Foundation, RUN DIPG, and Surfers Paradise Rugby Club events.

The ACGS project required the most extensive work, featuring a 10-minute highlight reel of the 2013 Lions tour that welcomed guests and a 2025 highlights package. This content was specifically upscaled to 4K 60fps to meet the demanding requirements of The Star's five-screen display setup, ensuring maximum visual impact across the large multi-screen venue.

Other events ranged from charity fundraisers to local rugby club celebrations, each requiring tailored video content suited to their specific venues and audience sizes. While these productions varied in technical requirements based on each venue's display capabilities, the ACGS project stood out as the most complex - demanding multi-screen synchronization and extensive upscaling for The Star's large display format.
bulletPoints: Produced video content for 5 rugby events.
Sourced and upscaled archival footage to 4K 60fps.
Created tailored video packages for diverse venues.

title: Game Time Graphics
subtitle: Dynamic social media graphics exploring sports visual identity
brief: Ongoing exploration of different visual approaches for sports social media content. Creating a diverse collection of graphics including scores, lineups, hype posts, and match announcements while experimenting with combining traditional Photoshop workflows and AI tools.
description:
A personal exploration of game time graphics showcasing diverse approaches to sports social media content. This collection features final scores, team lineups, gameday hype posts, and match announcements across various sports. Each piece demonstrates different visual styles and techniques.

The designs combine traditional Photoshop workflows with AI tools to create engaging social content that captures the energy and excitement of game time. From bold typography treatments to dynamic player imagery, each graphic explores different ways to present sports information while maintaining visual impact.

This ongoing collection serves as both a creative outlet and a testing ground for new techniques in sports marketing design.
bulletPoints: Final scores, lineups, gameday posts, announcements.

title: MitchIvin XP
subtitle: Nostalgic desktop experience meets modern web portfolio
brief: Transform nostalgia into a functional portfolio experience that would immediately grab attention and stand out from conventional portfolio sites. Plan to recreate the entire Windows XP desktop interface with authentic behaviors while adapting it showcase my design work.
description:
A fully functional Windows XP interface reimagined as a modern portfolio website. This project transforms nostalgia into an interactive experience where portfolio sections become native Windows programs, complete with draggable windows, resizing functionality, and an authentic start menu system.

Built from scratch using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, the site features a working Windows Media Player interface with embedded YouTube controls, an era-appropriate MP3 player, and every Windows interaction you remember; from the desktop selection box to double-click desktop icons. The window management system includes proper stacking, taskbar integration, menu bars, toolbars, and status bars that all function as expected.

Each Windows behavior had to be carefully recreated, tested, and refined. The real challenge came in making this desktop-first interface fully responsive while preserving the authentic experience across all devices. Some portfolio conventions were deliberately broken to maintain the Windows illusion.
bulletPoints: AI-assisted development from zero coding knowledge

title: Keep The Score
subtitle: Custom CSS component development from static design mockup
brief: Client needed their static scorebug design converted into a functional CSS component. Pure CSS implementation that integrated with their existing codebase to enable dynamic updates for team names, scores, and colors without requiring new design assets.
description:
Commissioned to transform a static scorebug design into a functional CSS-based component. Working from a provided design mockup, I built the scorebug to client specifications without using SVGs, ensuring it could integrate directly into their existing codebase.

The component allows the client to update all dynamic elements including team names, scores, and colors through their codebase without requiring additional design assets. Built with modular CSS that maintains the original design while providing flexibility for content updates.

Leveraged AI tools to streamline the development process, focusing on design accuracy and client requirements while ensuring clean, functional code output.
bulletPoints: Static design to functional CSS component.
No SVGs, fully integrated with client codebase.
